page.title: 13HOUSING IN SOUTH LEAMINGTON.
page.content: In the square we surveyed (04320264) there were many roads containing a lot of houses. We decided to count them. Everytime we came to a house we recorded it on our tally chart. Altogether there were 45 streets in our one square. There were too many houses for us to count alone, so we all had three streets each. When we had finished counting the houses we came up with these results. There were 36 detached, 903 semi-detached, 665 terrace, 464 flats, 15 bungalows and 6 maisonettes. Most of the semi- detatched were built in the 1920's but the terraced houses were older and were built in Queen Victoria's reign. The total number of homes in our square was found to be 2091. We didn't think there would be quite as many as there were.
